creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
inscription:
Signature, Stamp, Label

-- in graphite on verso: B376
-- label on mat: Christopher Mendez 51 Lexington Street London W1R 4HL
markings: red stamp on recto, top edge: Antoine Vivenel, Lugt 190; Christopher Mendez label
provenance: Antoine Vivenel (1799-1862), Lugt 190, Paris (sale Paris, July 1862). [Christopher Mendez, London; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
text: Stags were the quintessential quarry for German hunters during the Renaissance. Craftspeople would have used this hunting frieze—one of nearly 50 in Virgil Solis’s repertoire of patterns—to decorate items like game boards, powder flasks, parade shields, hunting horns, crossbow winders, and, of course, armor.
title: Stag and Hare Hunt
